column4: Kaot: yeah, everything i find is for the command line i think... i dont know jack about iptables :)
you should be able to just load your tables as normal, minus the port-forward, then run the command I gave you, then iptables-save >iptables.rules
thanks!
For whhatever reason, the port is not forwarded... any idea?
paste your current iptables rules please
window 2
http://pastie.caboo.se/23357  i don't even see 2525 in there although i ran the line you sent me
huh... its at the top, sorry :)
erm.  that's wayyyy to many lines.  edit that file to remove all the prerouting rules except the middle one, and then iptables-restore your ruleset
ok thats what i have now (but still doesnt work):  http://pastie.caboo.se/23358
looks like you've got a DROP rule for all traffic destined for 127.0.0.0/8....
but aprior rule to accept all on loopback... guh.  what generated these rules?
Kaot: a wizard i found online...
experimental telnetting to your 63.99.9.66 suggests that traffic is in fact getting DROP'd for some reason, I suspect the LINWIZ-INPUT ruleset...
you might try something like iptables -I INPUT -d 127.0.0.1 -p tcp --dport 25 -j ACCEPT
I got it.  I forward 2525 to  externalip:25 instead.  is there a reason why i would NOT want to do that?
eetfunk not really.  I imagine the idea here is to get around a port 25 block by your isp or similar.  Either way should work.
thanks! it sure did the trick :)
I just noticed it working, I tried to drop you a line but your anti-spam blacklist doenst' like my IP  :\
that's how you know i'm doing it right :D
lol... I'm bummed by that sort of thing, I used to run my own mailserver, then of course spammers wrecked it for everybody.  Oh well.
